titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lois Mulkearn Research Files, 1937-1956 DAR.1981.01
titlestmt.author: Shaun Hayes and Kate Colligan.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:30:18 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The collection consists of manuscript drafts, topic notes, transcripts, and correspondence collected by Lois Mulkearn, the first librarian at the University of Pittsburgh's Darlington Memorial Library and a historian. Mulkearn authored and co-authored a number of books about Western Pennsylvania history, including A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania. This collection contains manuscript drafts and topic notes associated with the book. Also included are transcripts of court cases involving various parties and George Mason of the Ohio Company dating from 1743 to 1763. The cases mostly pertain to debts owed to the Ohio Company by various men and women. Additionally, there are notes related to industrial hygiene and safety during the late eighteenth to mid twentieth centuries which are associated with an unknown publication or lecture and drafts of essays written by Mulkearn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of manuscript drafts, topic notes, transcripts, and correspondence collected by Lois Mulkearn, the first librarian at the University of Pittsburgh's Darlington Memorial Library. A portion of the materials is related to the book A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania, written by Lois Mulkearn and Edwin V. Pugh and published by the University of Pittsburgh Press in 1954. The notes and manuscript drafts for the book are arranged by topics relating to the subject of the book, namely histories of various locations in Western Pennsylvania.

Additional materials consist of transcripts of court cases involving George Mason of the Ohio Company, which was founded in 1747 and represented the trading and land prospecting interests of a handful of Virginia planters, and settlers who were in debt to the company. The cases are listed in alphabetical order by the last name of the party involved and date from between 1751 to 1763. It is possible these transcripts were used in Mulkearn's book George Mercer Papers, the authoritative volume on the Ohio Company published by the University of Pittsburgh Press in 1954.

Other materials in the collection consist of notes about industrial safety and hygiene during the late eighteenth to mid twentieth centuries prepared for an unknown lecture or publication and drafts of Mulkearn's essays on a variety of historic topics.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Lois Mitsch, niece of Lois Mulkearn, to the Darlington Memorial Library in 1981.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This collection was located in the Darlington Memorial Library in the University's Cathedral of Learning until 2007 when it was moved to the ULS Archives Service Center for processing, storage, preservation and service. However, it remains in the custodianship of the ULS Special Collections Department.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Lois Mulkearn Research Files, 1937-1956, DAR.1981.01, Darlington Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lois Mulkearn Research Files, 1937-1956, DAR.1981.01, Darlington Collection, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Shaun Hayes in August 2008.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.bibref: Mulkearn, Lois, and Edwin V. Pugh. A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania. [Pittsburgh]: University of Pittsburgh Press, 1954.
Mercer, George, and Lois Mulkearn. George Mercer Papers Relating to the Ohio Company of Virginia. [Pittsburgh]: University of Pittsburgh Press, 1954.

did.unittitle: Counties in Western Pennsylvania Research Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of notes describing the locations and histories of counties in Western Pennsylvania. The information is grouped by specific counties, and includes correspondence between Mulkearn and historians from county governments and historical societies. The time period covered is the mid-nineteenth to early twentieth centuries. In many cases, the information is divided by locations Mulkearn and Pugh included in A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania Notes and Revisions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of research notes related to A Traveler's Guide to Historic Western Pennsylvania that detail historic locations within the city of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and surrounding communities, including Sewickley and Fox Chapel. Notes are included about specific locations and historic events. There are also manuscript drafts from Mulkearn and Pugh's book with revisions and correspondence from local historians.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series III consists of transcripts of court cases between George Mason, an agent of the Ohio Company, and parties owing debts to the Ohio Company. The cases date from 1750 to 1763. Examples of documents enclosed in the files include promissory notes and arrest warrants for the party in debt. The records are modern copies of court files created in Fredrick County, Virginia. They are arranged by the last name of the defendant involved.

Other materials chronicle land surveys and court cases involving attempts of the Ohio Company to obtain land in Maryland, Virginia, and Ohio. It is possible these transcripts were used in Mulkearn's book George Mercer Papers Relating to the Ohio Company of Virginia, the authoritative volume on the Ohio Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series IV consists of notes about industrial safety and hygiene. The notes regarding industrial hygiene and safety focus on the working conditions of the steel industry in Pennsylvania. They are on index cards and appear to be for an unknown publication. Citations from different bibliographic sources are included. Some of the note cards are fastened together by subject. Most of the materials cited date from the early eighteenth to early twentieth centuries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series V consists of transcripts of works written by Mulkearn. Included is a transcript of a journal she kept while in Great Britain before the start of World War II. The works transcribed relate mostly to colonial Western Pennsylvania. On some transcriptions, handwritten notes and corrections to the text are included.
